** Data Science Santa Clara, CA, United States

**Your goal – to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through data and analytics.   
  
****Organization: Data Engineering** The Data Engineering team is central to Chegg – supporting every business line and functional organization at the company. It is a team composed of data modelers, data engineers, data science engineers and architects. The team influences strategy and tactics for Chegg’s data ecosystem.  
  
**Role:  
Data Science Engineer  
  
**Your primary focus will be bringing to production a new set of data products and services at Chegg. These will be built upon data science, recommendation systems, and other algorithmic approaches. We have no attachment to legacy processes. You will work very closely with our Analytics team to bring Big Data solutions to our application layer. You’ll select the best technologies and influence which algorithms make sense to use.  
  
This is a highly technical role and not for amateurs. You will need extensive
experience in working with various Big Data tools, machine learning models,
and engineering platforms. In addition, you must be a leader that can provide
guidance and mentorship.  
  
** Responsibilities  
**

  * Influence data science algorithms and services that will be used as the backbone of recommendation engines, discovery platforms, custom matching services, and for internal analysis purposes.
  * Migrate models and systems from prototype to full production.
  * Participate in the architectural design of data science platforms that will unite data science capabilities with data engineering, and product engineering.
  * Develop presentations to communicate broadly across the product groups and business units.  

**Requirements:  
**   

  * B.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, Math or related quantitative fields.
  * 5-7 years of demonstrated success in moving systems from their prototype stage into full production.
  * Have an extensive engineering toolset including an advanced understanding of MapReduce, and machine learning algorithms.
  * Expert with Hadoop from both the operational and engineering perspectives
  * Expert with Java in the MapReduce use case.
  * Fluent in writing SQL queries for data manipulation.
  * Passionate about producing high-quality engineering deliverables and communicating results to a broad audience.
  * Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams.  

**Preferred:   
**

  * Expert in at least one of the scripting languages such as Python, Perl or Ruby.
  * Experience working with Amazon EMR.

description:
Job ID: 180858  
Location: München  
Organisation: Infrastructure & Cities Sector  
Mode of Employment: Unbefristet  
  
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied  
  
  
  
In der Division Mobility sind die Zugtechnik und die Bahnautomatisierung von
Siemens zusammengefasst. Die beiden Bereiche adressieren das Wachstumsfeld
Smart Mobility mit intelligenten und integrierten Lösungen. Dazu gehören unter
anderem Schienenfahrzeuge und die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen,
Bahnelektrifizierung, Infrastrukturlogistik sowie intelligente Verkehrs- und
Transportsysteme.  
  
  
  
Werden Sie jetzt Teil unseres Teams von Mobility als Data Science Engineer
(m/w) in München.  
  
  
  
Was sind meine Aufgaben?  
  
  
  
\- Entwicklung innovativer Lösungen zur Datenanalytik bestehend aus
entsprechenden Technologien, Algorithmen und Applikationen – von der
Ideenentwicklung über Prototypen bis hin zu skalierbaren industriellen
Systemen  
\- Identifizierung und Bewertung unbekannter Beziehungen in den Daten vom
Fahrzeugen, Infrastruktur und anderen Daten um businessrelevante Erkenntnisse
zu gewinnen  
\- Durchführung explorativer Datananalysen in komplexen Datenstrukturen  
\- Erstellung wiederverwendbarer analytischer Modelle und Operationalisierung
solcher Modelle in der Analytikplattform  
\- Erstellung entsprechender Visualisierungen für die Ergebnisse derartiger
analytischer Modelle  
\- Zusammenarbeit mit Businessverantwortlichen zum Verständnis der
Geschäftsanforderungen und zur Identifizierung von Geschäftsmöglichkeiten
durch Datenanalytik  
\- Implementierung und Management von “Big Data”-Projekten mit dem Fokus auf
moderner Datenanalytik, maschinellem Lernen und industriellen Applikationen  
  
Was bringe ich mit?  
  
  
  
\- Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Mathematik,
Physik, Ingenieurswissenschaften oder ähnlicher Fachrichtungen  
\- Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Kontext von “Data science” und moderner
Datenanalytik  
\- Starke Erfahrungen in Technologien, Algorithmen und Methoden zur
Datenanalytik, insbesondere im Umfeld Data Mining, maschinellem Lernen und
Simulation  
\- Kenntnissen relationaler Datenbanken (SQL) und NoSQL-Datenbanken bzw.
Hadoop, sowie Programmierkenntnisse insbesondere in Java, C# oder C++  
\- Erfahrung in der Nutzung analytischer Tools und Systeme, insbesondere R und
anderer Arbeitswerkzeuge zum Data Mining  
\- Fähigkeit Schlussfolgerungen aus Daten zu ziehen und entsprechende
Handlungen vorzuschlagen  
\- Starke Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, insbesondere die
Fähigkeit komplexe Analysen in klarer und umsetzbarer Form den Geschäften zu
kommunizieren  
\- Selbstmotivation, Initiative, Durchsetzungsfähigkeit und starke
Ergebnisorientierung

Up to £80K base + bonus + benefits, location: London with UK travel when
needed

Superb opportunity for a Head of Data Science to join my end user client to be
responsible for evangelising big data technology/data science and to lead the
Data Science Centre of Excellence.

A huge bonus will be that you have exposure to data science and data analytics
projects within a HR Solutions company or a HR consulting organisation.

This is an excellent chance to build your career prospects within a company
that is thriving with some of the most exciting data science and data
analytics projects in the world

description:
Surrounded by water, mountains, and cherry blossoms, we are proud to push
the...

Die Audible GmbH ist ein führender Anbieter von Hörbuch-Downloads in
Deutschland. Unter www.audible.de sind momentan mehr als 150.000 Titel in
deutscher, englischer, spanischer und französischer Sprache von mehr als 800
Verlagen erhältlich - darunter die größte Auswahl ungekürzter Hörbücher.
Audible ist weltweit exklusiver Hörbuch-Partner des Apple iTunes Store.
Audible gehört seit einigen Jahren zum E-Commerce-Unternehmen Amazon.  
  
Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Berlin suchen wir einen engagierten und
begeisterungsfähigen  
  
  
Werkstudent – Data Science (m/w)  
Als Werkstudent im Bereich Data Science unterstützt Du uns vorrangig bei der
Verarbeitung und Analyse unserer Datensätze. Dabei arbeitest Du unter der
Leitung eines Data Science Director und eng mit unserem Marketing Team
zusammen. Du lernst dabei verschiedene statistisch-mathematische Modelle
anzuwenden und umfangreiche Analysekonzepte zu verwerten.  
  
Deine Aufgaben:  
· Unterstützung des Data Science Teams bei der analytischen Erschließung
verschiedener Phasen des Kundenlebenszyklus in einem internationalen (auch
nicht europäischen) Kontext.  
· Unterstützung unseres Data Science Teams bei statistischen Analysen entlang
ihrer gesamten Wertschöpfungskette: Problemformulierung, Anschluss und
Erkundung möglichst passender Daten, Modellbildung, Modellimplementierung.  
· Als Berater/Mitdenker pflegst Du einen engen Kontakt zu unserem Marketing
Team, um neue Strategien zu entwickeln.

  
Dein Profil:  
· Du hast eine Vorliebe für Datensätze sowie Modelle und interessierst Dich
für gesamtheitliche analytische Herangehensweisen mit einem Bias für
Pragmatismus.  
· Codes und Simulationen sind eine Leidenschaft von Dir.  
· Du hast Kenntnisse in mindestens einem der folgenden Programme:
“Languages”-C, Mathematica, MatLab, Python, R, SAS.  
· Deine Sprachkenntnisse in Englisch sind sehr gut.

  
Deine Aussichten:  
· Langfristiges Mitwirken (idealerweise 2 Jahre) als vollwertiges Mitglied in
einem tollen Team mit der Möglichkeit, Dich mit Deinen persönlichen Stärken
individuell einzubringen und Branchenkompetenz sowie technisches Knowhow
aufzubauen.  
· Spannende Einblicke beim weltweit führenden Anbieter für Hörbuch-Downloads
in einem stark expandierenden, an Amazon angelehnten, internationalen und sich
permanent bewegenden Umfeld und einer außergewöhnlich schönen Arbeitsumgebung
in Berlin Mitte.  
· Wir suchen eine Unterstützung für ca. 20 Stunden in der Woche. Vergütet wird
Deine Tätigkeit mit 12,- € pro Stunde. Die Abrechnung erfolgt per
Lohnsteuerkarte.  
  
Trifft dieses Profil auf Dich zu und hast Du Lust, mit uns zusammen die
Entwicklung eines neuen Marktes aktiv voranzutreiben? Dann freuen wir uns Dich
kennenzulernen! Bitte sende uns Deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit
Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, sowie ggf. Arbeits- oder Praktikumszeugnissen über
unser Bewerbungstool.  
  
Durch Zusendung Deiner Unterlagen stimmst Du der Speicherung Deiner Daten in
unserem Bewerbungstool zu. Deine Daten werden ausschließlich für den
Bewerbungsprozess genutzt.

description:
**The Company**

Our client is one of Australia's leading and largest Financial Services
Organization that has expanded its operations beyond the Australian shores.
The organization has a large range of financial offerings to both public and
private clients across the retail, corporate and institutional banking areas.
They have a very large technical footprint that combine a dynamic range of
technologies in a complex landscape. Due to internal promotion they now
require a technical (Infrastructure/Operations) Lead Capacity (demand
management) and Performance Engineer with a passion for Data Science/Analytics
and Modelling as it relates to the Resiliency and High Availability of
business critical banking systems.

**The Group**

This Performance team has a very large remit, to evaluate and improve bank
wide systems with a focus on high availability, performance, scalability and
reliability. Comprised of Solution Performance Engineers they are accountable
for the availability health of key production systems with a particular focus
on governing, evaluating, managing and influencing non-functional risks &
attributes across the solution delivery life cycle (requirements, design &
architecture, testing). This accountability traverses to the production
environment with accountability for capacity planning and providing quality
assurance over the accuracy of tactical performance, capacity and availability
analytics delivered by other teams.

**The Role**

After laying the groundwork and initiating the creation of an advanced
Capacity and Performance based algorithmic analytics and modelling system for
the banks performance group the current incumbent is moving into a more senior
position. To fill these shoes, so to speak, you'll need a thorough
understanding of IT Performance, Resilience, High Availability and Capacity
(Demand Management) across business critical banking/transactional systems as
it relates to the world of Operations (DevOps). To be successful in the
performance group you'll need a holistic/enterprise understanding of how all
technology layers, Infrastructure (OS, Database, Networks),
Middleware/Messaging and Application, interrelate and ultimately affect large,
high volume web portals. Essentially you'll be responsible for the analysis of
these systems and to work with the business to optimize, eliminate bottlenecks
and project future usage. There's a large emphasis on Data Science (Big
Data)/Analytics and modelling so proficiency in this area along with related
technologies like: R, Hadoop, Haskell or similar are essential.

**Skills required**

  * Expertise in IT Capacity and Performance: Data Science/Analytics, Statistics and Modelling. 
  * An Infrastructure/Operations (DevOps) background with a deep understanding of how all technology layers: Infrastructure (OS, DB, NW), Middleware/Messaging and Application interrelate. 
  * A strong base in Infrastructure or Operations (Support) ideally DevOps. 
  * Deep understanding of systems architecture in large complex organisations. 
  * Experience performance tuning large, complex web portals and/or Back End systems - experience in Telco, Gaming/Betting, Transactional, Trading Systems would be advantageous. 
  * Technically proficient with Data Science/Big Data Tools: R, Ruby, Hadoop, Haskell or similar. 
  * Technology related Degree/Diploma and/or industry relevant certifications.
  * Full, unrestricted Australian work rights (Citizen/PR).

**Keywords: **Capacity Planning, Capacity Lead, High Availability, Infrastructure, Performance Metrics, Tuning, Optimisation, High Volume Portals, Data Science/Analytics, Statistics, Modelling.

If this position interests you, please submit your resume via the 'Apply Now'
button or email. Or for further information please contact **Daniel** quoting
reference **CAPSTONE**.

Unfortunately this opportunity does not offer visa sponsorship so please only
apply if you already have full working rights for Australia.

**All communications will be treated as confidential and the more we know about you the better we can help you ...**

opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering
innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s everywhere – transforming
how we work and play. Are you leading the way as a digital disrupter?
Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life
across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital
you’ll create it, own it, and make it a reality for clients looking to better
serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises.

**Accenture Digital** is powered by three practices –Mobility, Interactive, and Analytics. As part of our Analytics practice, you’ll deliver analytically-informed, issue-based solutions that help clients make faster, smarter decisions. You’ll play a critical role in helping them tackle complex business issues. 

**Accenture Digital Analytics **professionals serve our clients by harvesting strategic insights from data and develop predictive modeling capabilities that target and deliver value across a wide array of corporate functions. Strong candidates will have a consulting or agency background with excellent subject matter expertise and hands-on experience in planning, supporting, implementing and deploying leading-edge digital marketing data & analytics solutions. 

**_Job Description_**

**The Analytics Executive **is a client-facing role that interprets, translates, and synthesizes client requirements into a solution that can be configured from a standard or highly-customized set of Accenture offerings. The Analytics Executive operates as a single point of leadership contact or as part of a team (on larger engagements with multiple Executives) accountable from Stage 0 (pre-engagement) to deal closure while leading delivery and/or the transition to the service fulfillment organization(s). 

**_Key Responsibilities for the Analytics Executive include, but are not limited to:_**

  * **General Management**
    * Lead and deliver large scale, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative analytical solutions for large companies 
    * Design, implement and oversee the quality of deliverables produced by our service professionals 
  * **Financials and Resourcing**
    * Understanding and clearly define the correct inputs required to create cost estimates 
    * Work with national resourcing teams to staff your projects

## + Basis Qualifikationen

**_Basic Qualifications:_**

  * Minimum of Bachelor's Degree required in a related field; strong preference for fields of study in the computer science, engineering, economics, data science and statistics 
  * 2+ years of increasing leadership experience in management consulting or industry 
  * 1+ years of Analytics delivery experience 
  * Experience with Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Cassandra, Hive, Pig, Impala, Parquet, etc.) and large Data Warehouse implementation (Oracle, Teradata, GreenPlum, SAP Hana, Netezza TF)
  * Experience in CRM Modeling, Analytics & Campaign Execution (SAS, Unica, Teradata, Oracle)
  * Expertise with the Microsoft Office suite (including advanced Excel skills with embedded Pivot Tables & Macros; advanced PowerPoint usage for storyboard design and presentation) 

****

**_Preferred Qualifications:_**

  * **Customer Analytics**
    * Ability to bring industry leading expertise and point-of-view on customer analytics, CRM, marketing, and customer data platform 
    * Strong understanding of statistical concepts and predictive modeling. (e.g., AI neural networks, multi-scalar dimensional models, logistic regression techniques, machine-based learning, etc.) 

  * **Education and Experience**
    * Master’s degree preferred in computer science, engineering, economics, data science and statistics

**_  
Professional Skill Requirements _**

  * Ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environment 
  * Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment 
  * Desire to work in an strategy, analytics and technology-driven environment 
  * Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills 
  * Excellent leadership and management skills
title: Accenture Digital & Analytics Analyst

description:
If you are excited about developers and interested in using data science to
make Windows a better platform, this is the job for you. We are a team in the
Operating System Group using data science principles to more deeply understand
our developers and further advance the Windows platform. Our mission is to
transform the organization into a data driven culture which makes product
decisions based on actionable metrics.  
  
We support a larger organization in its quest to improve quality through the
use of data. Working in partnership with other developer-focused teams, we
will ensure a great developer experience built from excellent tools, a world-
class API surface, and a solid Windows platform. We will utilize the Build-
Measure-Learn loop to enhance the lives of developers on a world-class Windows
platform.  
  
This Senior Software Engineer position will focus on applying machine learning
and data science techniques to our business questions. Work will include
conducting data analysis for broad insights, providing insight to our data
science projects, and training others on critical tools and processes. Our
team is highly iterative and candidates must be willing to try new things,
learn from failure, and continually improve.  
  
We are looking for a candidate who is an experienced software engineer who
also understands the fundamentals of data science and machine learning. We
work closely with other teams making collaborative skills a big plus.  
  
Required Skills:  
8+ years of software development and/or test development  
A Computer Science degree or equivalent experience  
Experience with Machine Learning and Data Science  
  
Optional, useful skills:  
R, IPython, PowerBI, or other data analysis tools  
Knowledge of the Windows platform (Win32/WinRT)  
Experience building Windows Apps  
Experience with C++, C#, JavaScript, and SQL  
  
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will
receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender,
sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin,
marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any
other protected status.
title: Senior Software Engineer

description:
**Job ID:** 180858  
**Ort:** München  
**Organisation:** Mobility  
**Art der Anstellung:** Unbefristet

**Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied**

In der Division Mobility sind die Zugtechnik und die Bahnautomatisierung von
Siemens  
zusammengefasst. Die beiden Bereiche adressieren das Wachstumsfeld Smart
Mobility mit  
intelligenten und integrierten Lösungen. Dazu gehören unter anderem
Schienenfahrzeuge und die  
dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen, Bahnelektrifizierung, Infrastrukturlogistik
sowie intelligente  
Verkehrs- und Transportsysteme.

Werden Sie jetzt Teil unseres Teams von Mobility als  
Data Science Engineer (m/w) in München.

**Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld –  
herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert**

  * Entwicklung innovativer Lösungen zur Datenanalytik bestehend aus entsprechenden Technologien, Algorithmen und Applikationen – von der Ideenentwicklung über Prototypen bis hin zu skalierbaren industriellen Systemen
  * Identifizierung und Bewertung unbekannter Beziehungen in den Daten vom Fahrzeugen, Infrastruktur und anderen Daten um businessrelevante Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen
  * Durchführung explorativer Datananalysen in komplexen Datenstrukturen
  * Erstellung wiederverwendbarer analytischer Modelle und Operationalisierung solcher Modelle in der Analytikplattform
  * Erstellung entsprechender Visualisierungen für die Ergebnisse derartiger analytischer Modelle
  * Zusammenarbeit mit Businessverantwortlichen zum Verständnis der Geschäftsanforderungen und zur Identifizierung von Geschäftsmöglichkeiten durch Datenanalytik
  * Implementierung und Management von “Big Data”-Projekten mit dem Fokus auf moderner Datenanalytik, maschinellem Lernen und industriellen Applikationen

**Ihre Qualifikationen –  
fundiert und adäquat**

  * Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik, Ingenieurswissenschaften oder ähnlicher Fachrichtungen
  * Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Kontext von “Data science” und moderner Datenanalytik
  * Starke Erfahrungen in Technologien, Algorithmen und Methoden zur Datenanalytik, insbesondere im Umfeld Data Mining, maschinellem Lernen und Simulation
  * Kenntnissen relationaler Datenbanken (SQL) und NoSQL-Datenbanken bzw. Hadoop, sowie Programmierkenntnisse insbesondere in Java, C# oder C++
  * Erfahrung in der Nutzung analytischer Tools und Systeme, insbesondere R und anderer Arbeitswerkzeuge zum Data Mining
  * Fähigkeit Schlussfolgerungen aus Daten zu ziehen und entsprechende Handlungen vorzuschlagen
  * Starke Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, insbesondere die Fähigkeit komplexe Analysen in klarer und umsetzbarer Form den Geschäften zu kommunizieren
  * Selbstmotivation, Initiative, Durchsetzungsfähigkeit und starke Ergebnisorientierung  
------

description:
## Tätigkeitsprofil:

Unsere Mission: Wir erforschen das Leben und die Erde im Dialog mit den
Menschen.

Das** Museum für Naturkunde Berlin (MfN)** ist mit seinen über 30 Millionen
Sammlungsobjekten eines der größten Naturkundemuseen weltweit.
Zusammengetragen als Beleg für die Diversität der Natur, sind seine Sammlungen
zugleich Zeugnisse der Wissenschafts- und der Kulturgeschichte. Das Museum für
Naturkunde Berlin ist als Forschungseinrichtung und Stiftung des Öffentlichen
Rechts seit 1. Januar 2009 Mitglied der Leibniz-Gemeinschaft.

**Bezeichnung: Softwareentwickler/in**

**Arbeitszeit: **100 v.H.d.regelm. wöchentlichen Arbeitszeit

**Befristung:** Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt und ist befristet bis 31.01.2016  
Drittmittelfinanzierung

**Entgeltgruppe:** E11 TV-L Berlin

**Projektbeschreibung:**  
Das DFG-geförderte Projekt „German Federation for the Curation of Biological
Data (GFBio)” (http://www.gfbio.org/) arbeitet am Aufbau einer grundlegende
Forschungsinfrastruktur, die den Austausch von biologischen und
umweltbezogenen Forschungsdaten ermöglichen bzw. vereinfachen soll. Das
Projekt befindet sich derzeitig in einer 18-monatigen Pilotphase.

Das Ziel des Forschungsbereichs „Digitale Welt und Informationsmanagement“ ist
die Implementierung einer zukunftsfähigen Architektur für naturkundliche Daten
und Datenrepositorien, welche neue Möglichkeiten zur Beantwortung von
Forschungsfragen sowohl im Bereich „Data Science“ als auch „Public Engagement
with Science“ eröffnet.

Die erfolgreiche Bewerberin/der erfolgreiche Bewerber wird folgende
**Aufgaben** im Rahmen des Projekt GFBio am MfN übernehmen:  
• Entwicklung GFBio relevanter Softwaretools (BioCASe Monitor Service, Specify
6 Workbench) und Anfertigen einer lückenlosen Dokumentation  
• Technische Betreuung und (konzeptionelle) Weiterentwicklung der
Datenpublikation am MfN  
o Weiterentwicklung einer Webschnittstelle zur langfristigen Publikation von
GFBio Daten des MfN (stabile URIs mit HTML und RDF Landing Pages)  
o Durchführung relevanter Anpassungen am MfN Datenmapping und
Weiterentwicklung eines Transformationsschemas (ABCD-Schema zum GFBio
Zielschema)  
o Vernetzung des MfN als internationales Data Center  
• Teilnahme an Projekttreffen, Telefonkonferenzen und Mitarbeit an
Fortschrittsberichten

## Anforderungsprofil:

**Anforderungen:**  
• Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Geo- oder Bioinformatik
oder eines ingenieur- bzw. naturwissenschaftlichen Studienganges, welcher
Aspekte dieser Disziplinen beinhaltet, oder mindestens 3-jährige
Berufserfahrung in zuvor genannten Bereichen und Mitwirkung in entsprechenden
Referenzprojekten  
• Gute Kenntnisse in der Programmierung webbasierter Software  
• Kenntnisse mind. einer höheren Programmiersprache (vorzugsweise Java)  
• Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Source Code Repositorien  
• Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Skriptsprache PHP  
• Gute Kenntnisse in der Verwendung von SQL-Datenbankmanagementsystemen
(vorzugsweise MySQL)  
• Kenntnisse in der Verarbeitung von XML und Erstellung von XSLT  
• Erfahrungen mit Austauschstandards naturkundlicher Sammlungsdaten (z.B.
ABCD, ABCD-EFG, DarwinCore)  
• Interesse an der Arbeit mit forschungs- und sammlungsbezogenen Daten
naturkundlicher Forschungsmuseen  
• Erfahrungen im Führen einer Projektdokumentation und im Verfassen von
projektbezogenen Fortschrittsberichten  
• Gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten  
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift  
  
**Hinweise:**  
Zur Sicherung der Gleichstellung sind Bewerbungen qualifizierter Frauen
besonders willkommen. Schwerbehinderte Bewerber/innen werden bei gleicher
Eignung bevorzugt.

Bewerbungen mit den üblichen Unterlagen (Lebenslauf, Zeugnisse) sowie einem
Anschreiben mit Erläuterungen zu Ihrer Erfahrung sind **bis zum 11.05.2015
unter Angabe der Kennziffer 21/2015 **an Museum für Naturkunde,
Personalreferat, Invalidenstraße 43, 10115 Berlin zu rich-ten.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass eine Rücksendung von Unterlagen und Bewerbungsmappen
nur mit beigefügtem Rückumschlag erfolgt. Zu unserer Entlastung bitten wir Sie
von der Zusendung von Bewerbungsmappen abzusehen, und mit der Bewerbung
ausschließlich Kopien in einfacher gehefteter Form einzureichen.

**Weitere Informationen: **  
Familienpolitik: Das Naturkundemuseum Berlin hat sich die Förderung der
Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie zum Ziel gesetzt und wurde hierfür mit dem
Zertifikat zum audit berufundfamilie der audit berufundfamilie gGmbH- eine
Initivative der Gemeinnützigen Hertie-Stiftung - ausgezeichnet.  
Weiterführende Informationen finden Sie unter: http://www.naturkundemuseum-
berlin.de/institution/vereinbarkeit-von-beruf-und-familie/

description:
# Vice President - MET Credit Quant

**Job ID: **3113380  **Full/Part-Time: **Full-time  
------  
**Regular/Temporary: **Regular  **Listed: **2015-06-04  
**Location: **Mumbai, India  
  
A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes
the way we do business. We’re committed to being the best financial services
provider in the world, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior
solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds,
able to see beyond the obvious and act effectively in an ever-changing global
business landscape. As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse,
international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven
by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile thinking is nurtured. And
at every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and
opportunities to excel.

In the world’s financial markets, Deutsche Bank CIB: Markets is an
acknowledged leader. We regularly win awards and top industry polls for our
high-performing investment banking products and services. Our 6,400 employees
around the world have a reputation for being highly focused. We provide
clients with unique insights, vast experience and an unparalleled level of
service.

Our top-ranked business offerings include bonds, equities, FX, money market
products, commodities and all forms of derivatives and structured investment,
financing and risk management products. We are active throughout Europe, North
America, Asia and all the world's emerging markets.

## Position Overview

**CIB Centre Overview:**

Deutsche CIB Centre, a Deutsche Bank Group company, provides extensive
structuring, quantitative analytics, platform development and execution
support from its location in Mumbai and regulated offices in the US and the
UK. With over 550 professionals performing cutting-edge modeling, quant,
analytics, and research, Deutsche CIB Centre assists Deutsche Bank’s Corporate
and Investment Banking teams around the globe in delivering innovative
financial solutions to international clients in less time and at lower cost.
This global reach provides you with huge opportunities to develop your career
locally as well as globally.

**Job Summary:**

Global Client Solutions (GCS) sits within the GFX business within FIC. It is
responsible for the development and management and revenue growth of GFX’s
client facing platforms for the purpose of distributing liquidity and
attracting transactional flow. The Maestro is one of the core GCS Platform.
This role is for Trading support of the Maestro business.

**Responsibilities:**

The Maestro business requires a follow-the-sun model in terms of trading and
monitoring capability. The Trading function, shared between the Hubs and DB
Centers, relates to the technical aspects of the services, system functioning,
market risk management and final pricing and terms. Customization and
integration of the system with client data also fall upon the trading
function.

DB Center resource would have primary responsibility for

  * Monitoring system orders, proper functioning of the hedging and client trade capture infrastructure
  * Initiation of all non-automated tasks (e.g. reporting, procedures within the tactical infrastructure)
  * Risk monitoring, and basic client support (trade-related, non-technical)

This role’s responsibilities would ideally expand to VBA coding/modifications
in the current infrastructure and the scripting that will drive certain
features of the future strategic architecture.

**Candidate Specification:**

  * Candidate should be a numeric, very detail oriented and vigilant individual
  * An experienced coder / Information Systems oriented individual would be strongly favored
  * Experience in FX markets, treasury, or trading support a plus as would be any experience in data science related projects.
  * Advanced Level Excel Skills including Macro and Automation
  * Experience with Microsoft Access
  * SQL preferred but not mandatory
  * Excellent communication and inter personal skills

In return, Deutsche Bank offers a challenging and rewarding career where your
contribution is valued and rewarded. We have an inclusive and friendly working
environment coupled with excellent facilities and benefits.

Deutsche Bank is an equal opportunity employer who seeks to recruit and
appoint the best available person for a job regardless of marital / civil
partnership status, sex (including pregnancy), age, religion, belief, race,
nationality and ethnic or national origin, colour, sexual orientation or
disability.

Please let us know if you require any adjustments to enable you to apply or
attend an interview. If you would like to discuss your requirements, or have
any concerns about the application process, please contact your recruiter.
title: Vice President - MET Credit Quant

CCMRelocation: No SelectionHockey is not just another sport. Hockey is a
commitment. Of time. Of body. Of self. A commitment that is measured in
bruises and missing teeth. In last second goals and divisional titles.Not
everyone has it. But for those of us who do, the opportunity for greatness is
immense. Commitment is at the very core of how we practice, how we play, and
what we wear. For over 100 years the most committed players have geared up
with one brand-CCM.Because no one is as committed to the game as we are. We
are designers of true hockey equipment. For true hockey players. From the
world’s best fitting skate to the world’s lightest stick.The committed players
of tomorrow will be gearing up with us, but will you be?The main
responsibility of the Biomechanics Research Developer - Sticks will be to
advise the stick engineering development team on player mechanics in order to
create and drive higher performing products. This will be achieved through
detailed analysis of internal data collection (lab and field testing) and
external research partners. Included in this role will be to evaluate all
testing protocols from a biomechanical point of view, and conduct regular
literature reviews for all product categories. This position will act as a key
liaison between the development teams and our academic research
partners.Responsabilities:Stick Performance Analysis• Manage the Stick
Performance Laboratory including all data collectionStick Fitting Analysis•
Design a method of fitting players with the correct stick for the shooting
techniqueBiomechanical Research• Conduct and present research on player
mechanics with an entrepreneurial spirit• Provide stick developers with
insights on player techniques and interactions with products• Keep up-to-date
with current research and maintain an archive of relevant scientific
publications for referenceOn Ice Testing• Review and create on ice testing
protocols• Conduct, analyse and report on testingAcademic Liaison• Monitor and
direct projects with Academic partners for all product
categoriesQualifications & Skills:• Master Degree in either Kinesiology or
Biomechanics, or a relevant field and preferable to have research experience
in sport; or a similar combination of educational and work related
experience.• Excellent command of both English and French; Oral and written;•
Ability to effectively communicate and positively influence both internal and
external stakeholders;• Knowledge of Microsoft Powerpoint, Excel and Word;•
Strong knowledge of research methods in biomechanics to ensure valid data
collection and advanced analytical tools for investigating human movement
including relevant software such a MatLab or equivalent• Strength in
statistical analysis tools such as Stastictica, R, or PSPP• Ability to work
efficiently and meet all internal timelines;• Excellent presentation skills,
experience giving presentations• Familiarity with hockey product and
marketingPosting Notes: Ville St. Laurent Quebec Canada Reebok CCM Americas No Selection

### Job Summary

Apple’s Analytic Insight team is responsible for mitigating fraud, waste and
abuse company-wide. AI Data Science Engineering is building an environment to
enable cutting-edge data analysis over Petabytes of data. We work side-by-side
with data scientists and implement scalable, easy-to-use systems and tools. We
are seeking a customer-oriented, passionate and driven Data Science Engineer
to lead our test automation and release management. Must be able to design and
drive large projects from inception to production implementation and beyond.
Must be a great communicator, team player, and a technical powerhouse.

### Key Qualifications

  * Mastery of one of C++, Python, Java, Scala or equivalent language
  * Experience with Relational databases and NoSQL databases
  * Experience with Agile software development process, Test-Driven development and Continuous Integration
  * Experience with software test and test automation
  * Solid understanding of the full software development lifecycle
  * Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills
  * Strong ability to learn new technologies in a short time
  * Experience in building data science or data analysis tools a plus
  * Machine learning background a plus
  * Experience with Hadoop, Hive, Spark a plus

### Description

You will design and build systems and tools to support the fraud prevention
efforts of Analytic Insight. The job will include: -Design innovative software
solutions to open-ended problems -Design test strategy and implement test
automation for internal tools and fraud services -Develop processes and tools
to enable safe and scalable deployment for fraud services The candidate is
expected to be self-motivated, pro-active and solution-oriented individual.

### Education

BS degree in computer science or equivalent field plus 7-10 years experience,
or equivalent.

**Description:**  
  
The Business Entity  
The Team  
The Corporate Information Security organization is responsible for protecting
the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of information and computing
assets, while enabling business productivity. Our global organization strives
to exemplify operational excellence, defend and protect Cisco and our
customers.  
About Cisco  
The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco
and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide.  
Cisco’s Information Security Data Governance team is responsible for governing
the handling and security of Cisco’s proprietary data, data entrusted to Cisco
(e.g. customer, partner, etc.), and personal data. Our mission is to drive the
how data is governed and drive the development and adoption of data-level
security solutions. We do these through engaging with the business functions
to drive ownership and accountability, use data science to derive data
security intelligence, innovate new approaches and solutions for classic
problems like data classification and inventory, and drive data security
architectures.  
  
InfoSec is taking the field of data science and applying it on towards data
security. We are building a team to take on this challenge. As part of this
team, you will:  
  
• Analyze system/database/application technical specifications to determine
types of data created/generated  
• Collaborate with InfoSec engineer team to design data collectors from
system/database/application  
• Collaborate with engineers to develop data collection scripts/interfaces  
• Conduct exploratory analysis of data to understand user behavior and
identify information security patterns, trending, and anomalies  
• Develop statistical data models to provide insights and intelligence in the
security of data and automation of data protection controls  
• Prepare summary report in easier to digest and graphical presentation of key
findings  
  
Qualifications:  
• BS or above in Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering  
• 2+ years of experiences in data mining and analysis  
• Basic knowledge on Unix/Linux system administration  
• Familiar with one or more of the following languages: Perl, Python, JAVA,
C++  
• Experience with tools and packages: MapR, SAP Hana, Casendra, Tableau, R,
MATLAB, SPSS  
• Excellent analytical skills  
• Good verbal and written English capability  
• Ability to work with global team, spanning across multiple time-zones  
• Must have a can-do attitude  
  
**Job Type: **Experienced  
**Opportunity Category: ***None

description:
Req Id: 88130

Bell is a truly Canadian company with over 135 years of success. We are
defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company's
vast potential.

To ensure we continue to be recognized as Canada's leading communications
company, we're committed to finding and developing the next generation of
leaders. This means creating best-in-class career and development
opportunities for our employees.

If you're passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new
challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our
team.

Our Network team plans, designs, builds and operates Bell's multi-billion
dollar networks, including the continued expansion of our fibre optic network,
HSPA+ and LTE - Canada's largest and fastest wireless network.

The service we provide is the foundation of Bell's competitive advantage and a
critical step towards achieving Bell's goal to be recognized by customers as
Canada's leading communications company.

Bell is a truly Canadian company with over 135 years of success. We are
defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company's
vast potential. To ensure we continue to be recognized as Canada's leading
communications company, we're committed to finding and developing the next
generation of leaders. This means creating best-in-class career and
development opportunities for our employees.

If you're passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new
challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our
team. The Network team plans, designs, builds and operates Bell's multi-
billion dollar networks, including the continued expansion of our fibre optic
network, HSPA+ and LTE - Canada's largest and fastest Wireline and wireless
network.

**Hiring team**

The Network Big Data Centre of Excellence and Business Intelligence team is
accountable for leading data technology and data science initiatives across
Bell's Network. The team works to create and implement technology strategies
and solutions to take advantage of vast amounts of Network data spanning
wireless, wireline, TV, and Media to improve Bell's network planning and
operation as well as Bell customers' user experience and to provide advance
data related services.

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of a newly established
and growing Bell Network Data Centre of Excellence team and help execute key
Big Data initiatives. You will have opportunities to apply and grow your data
architecture skills by working with experts in the field and using state of
the art BI and Big data tools, as well as apply and grow your business and
leadership.

**Key Responsibilities**

  * Lead and participate in the design and implementation of Big data and BI solutions using Hadoop and Apache open source components as well as enterprise grade BI and analytics solutions from leading vendors
  * Analyse user requirements and create effective and efficient data related solutions
  * Perform data exploration, mining, and forecasting
  * Explore and propose solutions to business problems that can be addressed using insights from data
  * Develops data architectures strategies, principles, standards and frameworks. Analyzes and evaluates alternative tactical and/or strategic data architecture solutions to meet business requirements

**Critical Competencies**

  * University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics. Graduate degree in Analytics or Data Science related discipline is an asset
  * Advance and hands on data experience spanning database design, data modelling, analytics, reporting, forecasting, data warehousing, Hadoop, ETL, etc. Experience implementing big data solutions using hadoop, SAS, and Microstrategy is an asset
  * Experience in requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing of software solutions especially data related using C++, Java, .net, Python and other programming languages
  * Gifted thinker who is extremely resourceful and can learn new technologies on the fly, driven and proactive
  * Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, at the same time fun and possess a good sense of humour
  * Team player who always put the interest of the team above all other priorities
  * A Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent
  * 8+ years technical experience with at least 3 years as data architect holding similar R&Rs as above, preferably in a Telecom environment.
  * Autonomous and energetic individual
  * Ability to oversee and work simultaneously on different requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines
  * Experience in technology research and evaluation as well as vendor selection
  * Strong aptitude to recognize opportunities for improvement in day-to-day work and take appropriate actions
  * Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills with a strong attention to detail
  * Experience in Networking and Telecommunications is a strong asset

Bilingualism is an asset (English and French)

**_**_**_Additional Information:_**_**_**

**Position Type:** Management   
**Job Location:** Canada : Ontario : Mississauga Canada : Ontario : Toronto   
**Application Deadline:** 08/28/2015 

**_**_**_ Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted. _**_**_**

Bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible
environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and
supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the
diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team
member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

description:
Job description  
IBM is searching for a Data Scientist as an intern to join our team. The
candidate will join the Emerging Sciences team in IBM’s new ExperienceOne
group. The ExperienceOne group uses advanced analytics to help organizations
attract, delight, and more effectively engage with their customers. We develop
state of the art statistical and optimization models that go directly into
ExperienceOne's software products. ExperienceOne provides software solutions
and expertise to help marketing, merchandising, sales and customer service
leaders achieve their specific business goals.  
  
The candidate will play a key role in helping the team to define, research,
and develop new statistical models that will be integrated into our products.
These products help many of the largest companies in the world improve their
engagement with customers by improving their customer's overall experience
with their brand. The candidate will have demonstrated experience with both
the quantitative research and software engineering aspects of data science.
Also, the candidate will be involved with studying how data from social media,
web traffic, marketing campaigns, customer service, and customer sales can be
used to improve customer engagement and lifetime value. This is a great
opportunity to work on some of the most challenging big data problems around
and to directly see the impacts of your work in the business results of
several of the largest retail companies in the world.  
  
Required

  * Bachelor's Degree 
  * Basic knowledge in data science 
  * English: Fluent   
  
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal
opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or
expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or
veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment
practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Zur Unterstützung unseres Data Science suchen wir **ab sofort **einen
**(Senior) Software Developer für Data Science (m/w) **zur Festanstellung.

  * Du entwickelst und pflegst unsere JVM-basierten Frameworks für das maschinelle Lernen, die Optimierung und automatisierte Entscheidungsfindung.

description:
**About the position**  
Salesforce.com is the enterprise cloud computing leader. Our digital marketing
technologies-including our flagship sales and CRM applications-help companies
connect with customers, partners, and employees in entirely new ways. With
more than 100,000 customers worldwide, we are proud to contribute to the
success of companies of all sizes and industries, around the globe. If you're
passionate about innovation, come help revolutionize how companies collaborate
and communicate with customers.  
  
The Marketing Cloud product team is looking for an experienced product
management and technology professional who is passionate and experienced at
partnering with data science engineering and has a track record for driving
new product capabilities from initial concept to successful delivery and
market adoption. The product management role has both inbound and outbound
responsibilities. Inbound responsibilities consist of working with the
technology team to deliver a world-class cloud computing application driven by
customers, prospects, advisory teams and internal product experts. Outbound
responsibilities include meeting with customers, prospects and industry
analysts to discuss product requirements and the product roadmap. This job is
for experienced product managers who thrive in a fast paced collaborative
environment and love working with the best technology team in the world.  
  
**Key responsibilities**  
• Work with product and engineering leadership to define and deliver the next
generation of our data science capabilities. This includes defining market
needs, product vision and strategy, roadmap creation and communication,
release planning, requirements gathering, functional specification all the way
through to customer enablement and success.  
  
• Provide leadership within the data science engineering team, and work very
closely with development, QA, user experience, documentation and other product
teams to execute the Marketing Cloud data science product strategy.  
  
• Employ an outside-in approach to data science by owning and driving feature
delivery end-to-end: writing user stories, working with user experience to
create prototypes for usability testing, working with development, technical
publications, and quality assurance teams to deliver a marketable product on
time.  
  
• Engage with enterprise customers for requirements gathering, feature
requests and roadmap updates.  
  
• Represent salesforce.com as a domain and product expert for data science at
customer interactions, industry and corporate events.  
  
**Requirements**  
• Academic expertise and/or equivalent experience in statistics, data science
and big data technology.  
  
• 3+ years of experience in Product Management or Systems/Business Analysis.  
  
• Analytics / BI / Visualization product management experience a very strong
plus.  
  
• Excellent organizational skills, analytic capabilities, and attention to
detail.  
  
• Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority.  
  
• Strong communication skills.  
  
• Cloud computing experience.  
  
• Demonstrated experience in the agile software development process.  
  
• Demonstrated experience in gathering and transforming customer needs into an
actionable product vision and requirements definition.  
  
• Strong troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills.  
  
• Bachelors' degree, with technical disciplines preferred  
  
LI-Y

### About Capgemini Consulting

Capgemini Consulting is the management consulting discipline of the Capgemini
Group, one of the world’s largest providers of Consulting, Technology and
Outsourcing services. We offer transformational excellence through
understanding specific customer needs in all business sectors.

Our Business Analytics Team is Capgemini Consulting’s business analytics and
modelling capability. The team delivers analytical solutions and advisory
services to a wide range of clients across a number of industry sectors. Our
Clients look to us to work with them collaboratively and provide the expertise
and structured thinking that will help them develop innovative solutions to
complex business problems. The team is currently expanding and we are looking
for graduates consultants to join the team.  
  

### Main Purpose of Role

You will be part of a leading Business Analytics practice in the UK within
Capgemini Consulting. You will undertake a wide variety of challenging project
work and help our clients optimise their business processes, improve
operations and drive performance improvement. You will be encouraged and have
the licence to develop new ways of delivering value. When allocating work, we
always try to match individual development needs with those of the business.
We are looking for talented people with relevant qualifications to help us
grow. The type of work that you might get involved in will vary from:

• Using modelling and analytically based techniques to solve business problems
as part of a major business transformation, or specialised pieces of work such
as economic modelling, business case development, risk modelling,
optimisation, simulation, systems dynamics and forecasting.  
• Developing and using modelling tools to support strategic decision making.  
• Delivering analytical advisory services to clients.  
• Developing both thought leadership points of view and new service offerings
to differentiate us in the marketplace.

Skills Required  
To succeed you will need to possess and demonstrate a number of competencies:

• A track record of academic achievement (ABB at A-level or equivalent) and a
2.1 degree in a numerate subject e.g. Maths, Stats, Industrial Engineering,
Economics  
• MSc. post-graduate qualification in an analytical subject such as
Operational Research, Data Science, Management Science, Statistics or Decision
Science. Essential or 1-2 years work experience in Analytics or Data Science.  
• You will be familiar with Customer Insight, Business Insight, Pricing
Strategy, Yield Management / Revenue Management, Data Analytics, Business
Modelling, Business Intelligence, Data Mining, Data Modelling, Operational
Research, Forecasting or Decision Science.  
• Experience of tools such as Splus/SAS/SPSS/R/Excel.  
• A proven ability to rigorously analyse complex issues and develop insights
and solutions.  
• An ability to provide creative thinking and innovative methods.  
• Good presentation and influencing skills.  
• An ability to work in mixed teams of colleagues and clients.  
• Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills with high levels of
enthusiasm and a good team player.  
• Drive & commitment to own and deliver outstanding work.
title: Management Consulting Graduate Programme 2015

description:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is
no exception. The People Analytics team acts as an internal innovation lab,
using analytical approaches to make sure Google continues to be a great place
to work. The team provides critical support to the business around issues of
organizational health and is responsible for not just taking the pulse of our
Googlers, but harnessing Googler feedback to drive change for the better. As
an analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and
curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and
qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone
who wonders "What if?" and then seeks out the solution.

As a member of the newly created People Data Science & Technology team,
you’ll help a team comprised primarily of social scientists learn to take
advantage of their increasing access to big behavioral datasets. You’ll bridge
the gaps between our team of researchers and Google’s software engineers and
statisticians. You’ll be extremely proficient technically with a strong
interest in applying your skills to improving understanding of human behavior.
You’ll be excited to learn from and contribute to the great Google statistics
community and to share and apply your learning on project with People
Analytics teammates.

Responsibilities

  * Access and leverage behavioral, network and unstructured data sets by writing and testing data mining, text and sentiment analysis, clustering, and other types of machine learning algorithms.
  * Collaborate with a team of analysts and social scientists to conduct in-depth analysis, design and analyze experiments.
  * Keep People Analytics connected to Google’s statistics community, act as our statistical subject matter expert and push the team forward on advanced analytical methods.
  * Influence senior social scientists, human resources and business leaders through strong communication skills and deep subject matter expertise.

Minimum qualifications

  * MA degree in Computational Science, Computational Data Science, Computational Social Science, Applied Statistics, Management Science and Engineering, Operations Research, Biostatistics or Data Sciences or equivalent practical experience.
  * 3 years of experience with machine learning, data mining or statistical work.
  * Experience with statistical analysis and classification methods like K-Means, KNN, SVMs, Deep Learning/Neural Networks, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Logistic Regression, Multinomial Logit, etc.

Preferred qualifications

  * PhD degree in a quantitative field (Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Operations Research, Biostatistics).
  * 5 years of applied experience with machine learning, data mining or statistical work.
  * Experience with unstructured data (e.g., text). Ability to use data to tell a story based on the insights from complex analysis.
  * Experience with web-based data visualization skills (e.g., D3.js). Front-end web development experience.
  * Experience drawing insights from large longitudinal behavioral datasets such as datasets that constantly track movement, from a perspective of enabling individuals vs. enabling companies.
  * Strong learning and teaching orientation: constantly seeking to improve your own skills and willing to invest in building the skills of those around you. Interest in social sciences in application of social sciences to People Analytics.
title: Data Science Manager, People Analytics Team

description:

Archimiddle delivers consultancy in IT architecture and Middleware to support
customers with architectural decisions and implementations. The IT landscape

This opens new opportunities for business, such as Big Data solutions, but at

As a data architect, you will be working with multiple data stores and data

You are able to take responsibility over architectural decisions with respect
to data, and you can help customers implementing Big Data solutions.  
  
You have a broad knowledge of data techniques and project methodologies and
you can be an active and reliable part of a development team.  
  
You will take responsibility for following tasks:

Guide the implementation of Big Data projects  
Be part of a team of Big Data developers  
Increase your data architecture and data science knowledge  
constantly  
  
Your profile

description:
__

### Company Information

Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with 2014 pro
forma annual revenue of circa € 11 billion and 93,000 employees in 72
countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting &
Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations,
Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services
through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional
services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge,
the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense,
Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector,
Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.  
  
Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps
organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide
Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is
listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos
Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, and Worldline.

Our ability to deliver Operational Excellence means that we are always ready
and able to help our clients address whatever challenges they face, wherever
they are in the world. We also place great emphasis on understanding and
meeting the needs and priorities of our clients, including their
sustainability objectives.  
  
Atos values the individual and strives to deliver an appropriate work-life
balance because a motivated and happy person can add untold value to our
clients and colleagues around the world.

For more information, please see the Atos corporate web site:.

### Job Description

The Sr Data Science Consultant is responsible for helping Atos clients
understand and extract value from their data. Working both independently and
as part of a team, the Sr Data Science Consultant will be involved in all
phases of (Big Data) analytics projects including: question formulation,
design, research and development, implementation, and testing. The ideal
candidate is able to explore and understand data and build advanced analytical
models independently, then present and discuss the resulting models to any
level of audience.

The data scientist role is a self-directive role, requiring very high level of
initiative and investigative/detective capabilities in achieving
goals/objectives for business clients.  
The Data Scientist uses scientific /analytical approaches to explore and
visualize available data, identifies gaps and needs for additional data,
builds/validates required analytic models (such as classification, clustering
or association, to name a few) for potential deployment/ implementation by
business clients in operations.  
This role will require working on multiple projects simultaneously in
collaboration with various cross-functional teams. The Data Scientist will be
responsible for periodically providing data-driven insights and conclusions
through presentations and prototype demonstrations.

**Responsibilities**:  
• Work with clients to gather and refine specific business problems and
scenarios and document analytical solution requirements  
• Create and maintain documentation of technical requirements including use
cases  
• Define the data requirements for specific business problems and Identify
sources of data in consultation with business clients (e.g., in-house data
store/warehouse, external data mart, etc.)  
• Identify and resolve data/information gaps for meeting business
objectives/goals including data quality issues and sources (data feeds, the
master data, etc.), and identify training and validation datasets as
appropriate  
• Build multiple analytical models to solve specific business problems using
commercial or open source toolsets  
• Work with stakeholders to establish minimum levels of performance criteria
for model selection  
• Work with Business clients to Validate/Test subset of model(s) and obtain
approval for models that achieve specified business goals  
• Report Analytical results in a variety of creative visual formats that
appropriately provides insights to business clients  
• Define technical requests for Technical Specialists to perform, such as
detailed data linking or parallel processing requests.  

  

### Job Requirements

**Required**:   
\- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Applied
Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related fields (equivalent work
experience considered).  
\- 5 years + hands-on experience in one or more Statistical Methods, such as
machine learning, information retrieval, data mining, Text Mining, Natural
Language Processing, Web Analytics or similar.  
\- Experience with Java  
\- Experience with SQL and relational database programming and/or distributed
computing platforms and query interfaces such as MapReduce, Pig, Hive.  
\- Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to express
complex ideas to any level of audience.  
\- Strong team player capable of working in a demanding environment.  
\- Eager to learn and apply new technologies.  
• Experience working with very large data sets, grouping together data and
visualizing results  
• Familiarity with extracting data from Hadoop using frameworks like Hive and
from MPP platforms, experience with some Java / python / simple map-reduce
jobs development  
• Experience with commercial modelling and simulation tools such as SAS
Enterprise Miner, SAS Visual Analytics, IBM SPSS Modeller, and open source
tools such as R, Weka.  
• Analytical Reasoning Skills: Adept at mathematical reasoning, Applies
scientific experimentation to business problems  
• Possess skills such as Analytical Model Design & Implementation,
Visualization/Report Design & Implementation  
• Business skills: Some level of industry sector understanding, product
understanding and process understanding  
• Strategic Thinking and Creativity Skills: See the Big Picture, have high
level of curiosity and willingness to experiment  
• Communication Skills: Excellent Written and Verbal Skills, Ability to
communicate effectively with senior level executives clients

**Desired**:   
\- Ability to write production level code.  
\- Exposure to Big Data technologies (Hadoop, HDFS, Pig, Hive, etc.).  
\- Familiarity with NoSQL databases (e.g., HBase, Cassandra, Mongo DB).  
\- Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools.  
\- Experience working with customers (consulting experience a plus).  
\- Diverse data set experience.  
\- Experience with PMML.  
\- Experience with Python or Scala

  * Sichtung und Auswahl von Technologien und Kooperationspartnern inkl. Einbettung neuer Technologien in aktuelle Architektur 
  * Aufsetzung von Monitoringlösungen 
  * Sicherstellung der Einhaltung der Daten- und IT-Sicherheitsrichtlinien im Konzern für alle Use Cases
